#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=On the culture of life
#Text=What do you think is the greatest threat to humanity ?
#Text=The lack of regard for life as being sacred I think would be my biggest threat to humanity .
#Text=What is the culture of life ?
#Text=How would you describe that phrase ?
#Text=It 's seeing all life , at all places , at all stages as beautiful and unique , sacred , a child of a loving God .

#Text=To me that 's what a culture of life is , and us having walked away from that , we 've had millions of abortions here , hundreds of millions around the world , people that should be here but are not .

#Text=Bobby Schindler , Terry Schiavo 's brother , endorsed your candidacy by saying that " Sam Brownback is the pro-life conservative we can trust to stand for all life , regardless of political calculations . "
#Text=Do you think the death penalty detracts from the culture of life ?
#Text=I do , and that 's why I am not a supporter of a death penalty , other than in cases where we cannot protect the society and have other lives at stake .
#Text=But again , I understand people who support the death penalty saying , " This is different , " whether it 's an innocent human life or somebody that 's committed a heinous crime .
#Text=In trying to move forward with a culture of life , I think we need to try to do that in every setting , including the use of the death penalty by the State .
#Text=On the Iraq War and the Middle East
#Text=Brownback visiting the troops in Iraq .
#Text=A common question I 've asked in my interviews is about the Iraq War and how it has affected someone as a person .
#Text=People often proffer their opinion on the war , but they do n't really talk much about how it has affected them personally , perhaps in their world view .
#Text=The writer Gay Talese insisted the war has not affected him at all .
#Text=" I wish it had , " he said .
#Text=Talese thinks there 's a problem with Americans not sacrificing enough , and he argued that we need conscription .
#Text=Do you think we need conscription , if not to support the manpower of the war , to make Americans more involved with the wars that we are fighting ?
#Text=Absolutely not .
#Text=I 'm absolutely opposed to conscription .
#Text=The military opposes conscription ; they want a voluntary force that signs up to be a part of the military , not people that are forced into it .
#Text=And I do n't think that 's a necessarily right way to look at it , as far as that we need to feel more of the pain of the conflict .
#Text=We 're getting close to four thousand young people that we 've lost .
#Text=I think a lot of people know individuals personally that have been touched by this war in that most difficult way .
#Text=I think it 's impacted a lot of people in very strong and profound ways .
